title: Marine Villa, Charlestown, Cornwall: review
text: Telegraph expert’s rating: 8/10 Marine Villa, a charming Georgian house, overlooks the tall ships moored in the historic harbour in the small village of Charlestown. After a spell at the beach, just beyond the ships, it is heavenly to return to crisp cotton sheets, white linen curtains, huge sofas and an art collection of taste and class. Delicious ready-to-heat meals can be delivered and spa treatments can be arranged on-site. Sleeps six in three rooms, with extra rooms available in the attached cabin or studio, both of which have separate entrances. Location: 8/10 Once a busy port exporting tin, Charlestown is a World Heritage site. Abandoned railway tracks run past the house alongside the keys. A cobbled street past the villa leads to the sea, with beaches perfect for swimming, rock pooling, combing and coastal walks in both directions. Marine Villa offers the perfect family retreat for those with a penchant for history and pirates The Shipwreck & Heritage Centre is a rainy day option close by. The Eden Project and Lost Gardens of Heligan are both within a 10 minutes’ drive. Style & character: 9/10 The house has great historic charm. Muted tones and wooden floors offer a calm interior where large sofas sprawl in front of open fires and light streams through sash windows. Cards and games can be found in the impressive antique tallboy and meals are served on a robust oak table. The décor has a nautical theme: ships in bottles, seafaring oil paintings, nautical lamps. These sit next to abstract canvases and Cornish pots, creating a chic atmosphere. Outside, a small private patio garden shelters behind a tall hedge, catching the sun for much of the day. Facilities: 9/10 Anyone travelling with toddlers will be delighted to find stair gates, socket covers, blenders, baby baths – every conceivable baby gadget and more. The small kitchen is well equipped and meals can be eaten in front of the fire in the dining room. The garden has a barbecue and outdoor shower. Marine Villa is well-equipped and child-friendly The delightful and atmosphereic old harbour master’s office on the quay is owned by the same couple, and guests at Marine Villa can take tea or watch the sun go down from this spectacular spot. Every bedroom has wonderful views, fluffy duvets and expensive linen. Bathrooms are of a similiarly high standard. Value for money: 8/10 Given the unique setting, this is exceptional value. Take advantage of the meals and spa treatments for the full five-star experience. Marine Villa from £185 per night in low season; rising to £370 per night in high. Free Wifi. Family friendly: 8/10 This provides the perfect family retreat for those with a penchant for history and pirates: an adventure for young and old. No dogs. Eating Whether you fancy a substantial fish pie or a freshly prepared lobster, there is no place like home. Delicious and well-priced meals can be provided upon request, and the smell of freshly baked pastries for breakfast is difficult to resist. For those wishing to cook for themselves, there is a supermarket nearby. Charlestown has good pubs, cafes and restaurants. Access for guests with disabilities Wheelchair users can sleep in the studio and gain access to the downstairs only.
